intro: Crepis latialis, commonly known as the broadleaf mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and thistles, and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are broad and hairy, and the flowers are usually pink or purple, blooming in late spring to early summer. Crepis latialis is often found in disturbed habitats and is considered a common weed in agricultural settings.
